Posted By: EKraj (9/2/2012 1:32:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
By far and away my favorite Vampire ever printed. Dropped him back into my Vamp deck when he reprinted, and started just walking all over my friends. Great card.  
  
And yeah, I'd have been completely unsurprised to see him upgraded to a rare. He's better than many rares, as it is.  
  
Also? This guy + Stromkirk Captain + Rakish Heir = Invincible, or damn near, anyway. Throw in an Akroma's Memorial (if you can manage the mana load) and he's unstoppable.
posts.html:

Also? This guy + Stromkirk Captain + Rakish Heir = Invincible, or damn near, anyway. Throw in an Akroma's Memorial (if you can manage the mana load) and he's unstoppable.

Posted By: Kaden_Shadows (9/9/2012 2:48:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
"Why are you running him, dad?"  
  
",,, Because we have to draft him."  
  
"He doesn't do anything right...."  
  
"Because he's the power creep Magic deserves, but not the one it needs right now. So we'll draft him. Because he can tank it. Because he's not balanced.  
  
"He's a board sweeping powerhouse. A win condition pull.  
  
*"A Dark Knighthawk."*

"A Dark Knighthawk."

Posted By: ThePantsAreDead (7/7/2012 8:57:04 PM)

posts.post_content:
Let me give you a little rundown.  
![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) 2/3? Nothing special.  
Flying? It's okay, but at this point it's just a black [Sunspire Griffin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sunspire Griffin).  
Lifelink? Sweet. Now it's above the curve.  
Deathtouch? Wait, what the hell? Now it's *way* above the curve...  
Vampire? With [Stromkirk Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stromkirk Captain) and [Vampire Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nocturnus) running around in Standard? Wow!  
Uncommon, $4 playset? Holy shit! Get me four!  
  
...oh wait, I already run four. 5/5

posts.post_content:
This guy is too good at pretty much every possible strategy other than combo.  
Block and gain life. Attack and remain unblocked (since your opponent doesn't want to lose all their creatures). Attack and kill a blocker. Seeing this guy across the board is one of the worst feelings available.
